inn1.comm: some swing to start off. Full and on the middle and leg, it curved in slightly, Fulton leans forward, turns it to right of midwicket for a single
around the off stump line, full in length, Fleming eases forward, pushes it out to cover region
lands on a length, on the off and middle line, curves away a touch, Fleming gets behind the line, steers to point
pitched on leg and middle line, straightened, Fleming falls over a touch while trying to work it to on side, and doesn't connect well.

Fleming's disastrous run against SL continues. Lands outside off stump, on a length, Fleming leans forward and is struck just outside the line. It was hitting off but the point of impact was just outside off and he was playing a shot. But Asad Rauf raises the finger. It was pretty close. It looked as if he was hit in front of off but the replays suggested he was outside.
probing line on the off and middle, pushed to the off side
probing line on the off and middle, pushed to the off side
sliding down the leg side. Fernando grunts in disgust.
on the legs, flicked past square-leg
beaten. In the temptation zone outside off, Fulton has a waft inside the line and it teases the outside edge.
full-pitched and straight on the middle and leg stump line, driven to mid-on.
peach. Landed on a length, around off stump line and shaped away. Fulton had to play at it and he did. Luckily for him, he pushed inside the line.

Stunner from Sangakkara. Full in length, landed on the off and middle and slanted away. Taylor has a stab at it, gets a outside edge and it flies low to the right of Sangakkara who dived full-length and plucked it inches off the turf. Fab effort. Double strike from Vaas has NZ reeling. What a start for SL.
around the off stump line, Styris leans forward, pushes it to cover region.
slants away from Styris who shoulders arms
close. This one came back in and almost trapped Styris. Fullish, on the middle peg line, Styris was leaning across, arrested the front foot movement quickly and turned it to the on side.
leans back, hits a length-delivery on the up, to cover
beaten Off cutter and it shaped away from Styris. He is sucked into a forward prod. Almost fatal.
back of length, outside off, stands up tall and punches it to point
lands on a length, on the off and middle, straightens, Fulton gets behind the line, pats it gently to the cover region
nagging line and length. On the off and middle and full in length. Fulton gives the full respect. Defends on the front foot.
And again. Just outside the off stump this time and again pushed to the cover region.
Short of length, outside off stump and punched to point.
Vaas continues to tease the outside edge. Another off cutter that angled away and Styris is attracted to it.
Pushes that one even further and Styris doesn't chase. Leans across and shoulders arms.
lands on the off stump line, on a length, breaks away, Styris intends to punch it to cover, adjusts for the movement, opens the bat-face, runs it to point
fuller, outside off stump line, driven to mid-off
maiden over. Another off cutter , around the off stump line, tapped back down the track. Three maidens in a row. The squeeze is on.
on the off and middle, pushed back to the bowler
In the zone outside off, Fulton moves closer to the line, makes sure it's not curving back in and lets it go through to the 'keeper
lands on the off stump line, slides on, pushed to cover
hits the deck short of length, outside off and goes on straight, left alone

risky single. A push to mid-off. It was full in length, on the middle stump line, Fulton pushes it towards mid-off and sees an opportunity for a run and sets off. Styris responds well. He is yet to get off the mark btw.
he will stay on zero. Full and in the channel outside off, left alone
Full and moving away, Fulton lets it fly past him.
a run. The sparse crowd clap. Sarcasm. On the middle and leg, tickled past square-leg
slow off cutter, around off stump, Styris picks it late, adjusts and defends
Poor styris. He slammed that one but Dilshan dives and prevents him from getting off the duck. Short in length and outside off, thumped to right of point where Dilshan makes a neat diving stop.
slowish off cutter, on the off stump line, pushed to the point region.
full in length, on the off stump line, pushed to cover

huge shout for lbw. Doctrove doesn't pull out the gun. It landed on a length, outside off, slided in and Fulton pushed forward to defend. The ball evades the bat and strikes him on the off stump line. It was hitting off. It was close.
Good reply. Shortish and Fulton swivelled off the front foot to pull it over midwicket. Now we have a contest.
outside off, stays in that zone, left alone
fuller and closer to the off stump line, driven crisply but straight to mid-off
Deja-vu. Vaas beats Styris. Another off cutter. It pitched on a good length, around off and middle and curved away. Styris has a waft and is beaten
still on 0. 18 balls faced. Leans forward and defends a length-delivery on the off stump line
Again, that nagging line around off and middle, pushed towards mid-off
Styris breaks free with a four through cover. Slightly short in length, on the off stump line, Styris leans forward, head over the ball and punches it through the off side. He can breathe easy now.
dabs to third man for a single.
on the off stump line, kept a touch low after pitching on a length, punched to mid-off
ful-pitched outside off, driven straight to mid-off.
leans forward, punches a length-delivery through cover
pitched on a length, around off and middle stump line, pushed to mid-off
fullish, on the off stump line, Styris works it behind square-leg
lands on a length, outside off, seams in, Fulton stands tall, pushes it back down the track

Ah! Guess what happened? Yep,  Vaas beats the bat. Again. And again. Around the off stump line, the only difference was that Styris' bat came outside the line and the ball squeezed through the bat and pad gap.
Back to regular programming. Beaten. Full and outside off, Styris drives, meets air, ball nestles into Sangakkara's gloves

Murali misses a run out. Full and on the middle, driven to mid-on and they rush across. Murali picks the ball, has a shy but doesn't hit. Styris had given up. Ian Smith, on air, screams, "NZ are panicking here."
Slightly short in length and Fulton capitalises. Leans back and pulls it high over square-leg. Cracking stroke.

Hmm... Styris is definitely feeling stifled. He tries to break free of the shackles with a slog. It was full in length, on the off and middle, he took out the front leg from the line and tried to heave it over the on side, just about gets it over mid-on
Whack. He gets it right this time. Leant forward and drove a over-pitched delivery over widish mid-on area. Sangakkara runs across to have a chat with the bowler
The aggressive strategy seems to be working. Maharoof drags back the length but offers some width outside off and Styris stands tall, gets on top of the bounce and punches it through backward point.
on the off stump line, pushed to the off side
slower one, dips outside off, tapped to the off side
Half-volley outside off, Styris leans forward, drives but straight to mid-off
Fingers on either side of the seam, it lands on the off and middle stump line, defended back to the bowler
full-pitched on the off stump line, pushed to cover

appeal for run out. Full and outside off, jabbed to backward point and Fulton wants a run. Dilshan swoops in, Styris sends Fulton back and he makes it in time to beat the direct hit. It is refered upstairs and not out is the verdict
back of length, on the middle stump line, dabbed to midwicket
yorker-length, Fulton wants to drill it straight down the track, gets a inside-edge on to the boot.
full-pitched , on the off stump, Fulton goes across the line, drives to mid-on. He wanted to get it through widish mid-on but can't get his placement right.
on a length, on the middle and leg line, straightens, Styris wants to drive it to the on side, gets a leading edge to point
Thwack. He backs away and has a slog, gets a inside-edge and it runs past midwicket
fullish and outside off, driven to mid-off
nice change of pace. On the off stump, Fulton was beaten initially but adjusted to get bat on ball. Inside-edge takes it behind square-leg
on the middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket
beaten. In the channel outside off, straightens and Fulton drives loosely.
banged in short, outside off, swatted to Murali at mid-on
shuffles across, places a length-delivery on the off stump line, through extra cover. Jayasuriya moves across from mid-off to make the stop.
picked-up over short fine-leg. It was a slower one but slipping down leg side, Fulton leant forward, flicked it behind square-leg
fullish, on the middle and leg, squirted to long leg. It was not a flick. It was not wristed away, rather the bat came across in an angle and he sort of swat-drove it across the line
lands on the off stump, on a length, kicks up a touch, Styris is surprised at that, adjusts by arching back, taking the bottom-hand off the handle, taps it to the off side
Maharoof continues. On the off stump line, punched to cover.
Caught by Mahela but it was a no ball. Such is life. Such is cricket. A slower ball on the middle and leg, Fulton is through his shot early - he tries to flick it  and scoops to Mahela at midwicket.
There he goes. Styris charges down the track, backed to the leg side and lofts a fullish delivery over mid-off

ANOTHER. Styris is piling on the pressure on Maharoof. He backed away and drilled a length-delivery through widish mid-on. The counterattack is on. Maharoof is bleeding runs. Sangakkara moves up to the stumps.
Fullish, on the off stump line, slight change of pace, driven to point
similar ball, similar shot.
fullish length ball on off, tapped away to mid-off and completes a quick single.
no ball called by Asad Rauf just as Fernando delivers and it's a wayward ball as well (could have well been called wides).
straighter this time, that's a good length slightly short of good length. Slightly slower one that, bowled with split fingers. Tapped away towards point

that was another slower one, drifting in on leg stump and it's full. Had that been straight, it could have been an lbw candidate. Styris tries to flick it but can't make contact. Ball deflects to the off side
pushes to mid-off and takes off for a single, Jayasuriya goes for the direct hit but that misses. Had it hit, that might have been referred upstairs
short and slightly outside off, Fulton pulls but can't get the timing, ball trickles away towards short midwicket and they complete a single

caressed through the covers. Full ball from Fernando and outside off, Styris leans into the drive and pierces the gap. Chamara Silva huts it down, dives close to the cover fence and prevents a boundary.

That is a huge appeal. Down the leg side from Vaas and Styris tries the scoop paddle, appears to have come off the face of the bat and the ball snucks between Sangakkara's pads. A raucious appeal from both bowler and keeper and neither can believe it, Stysis wonders why it hasn't been called a wide
similar ball, slightly fuller on leg and Styris pulls off the paddle scoop this time, past short fine leg for a four this time. Was lucky but he seems to be making most of it
back foot defence to cover
driven to extra cover on the front foot, straight to the fielder
straight and curving in from Vaas, can't do much with those. Styris plays it cautiously back to the bowler
straight and short of a length again, Styris has no room to drive expansively, driven straight to cover

That's a cruncher from Fulton, slightly short and wide of off and he latches on to the pull this time. Stands up tall (and unlike in the last over when he missed out) clatters it to midwicket for a cracking boundary
on the back foot and patted awawy to the off side. And for those of you who ask, Sangakkara is not standing up when Fernando is bowling
full and on off, appears to have split the seam this time as well, driven straight to mid-off
full and swinging from off to middle, Fulton turns the face of the bat and gets it past short midwicket for a brace
Another slower ball and Fulton tries to loft it over midwicket. Too early on the shot and the bottom edge luckily doesn't go back onto the stumps. That could have easily been played on
oversteps this time, it's a full ball and Fulton works it away to the off side
driven to the off, better line this time just outside off
full-pitched outside off, driven to mid-off
slower one, on the off and middle, pushed to on side
Goddim! Fullish, on the middle and leg, swung straight to Chamara at deep square-leg. Vaas is thrilled to bits. And why not.
beaten. Another off cutter curving away past the outside edge.
from round the stumps, lands on the leg stump line, turns down leg side. Styris tries to flick, misses.
Huge shout for lbw. Landed on the middle stump line, turned in and struck him in front of middle and leg. That looked pretty close but Asad Rauf doesn't agree. It was a faster one.
on the leg and middle, bunted through mid-on
topspinner, on the off stump line, the bearded McMillan pushes at it, gets a outside edge and Mahela, at slip, dives to make a neat stop
swept from outside the off stump to long leg
doosra, breaks away , pushed to point
pushes that one through flat and quick, on the leg side, tickled to short fine-leg
drifts in from outside off, pushed to cover point
on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket
on the off stump line, worked to point
slower in the air, on the off and middle, Styris is early into his drive, edges it through cover point
arm-ball, on the off and middle, defended on the front foot.
slower, fuller, on the middle, driven back down the track.
on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg

Murali removes McMillan. Tossed-up, on the middle stump line, on a length, McMillan tries to sweep, the ball turns in and bounces, gets a top-edge and bobs away to the left of short fine-leg fielder. Sri Lanka are on top here. And this is Murali's second over. Eight more to tackle. NZ in big trouble.
beaten. From over the sticks, it landed outside leg stump and turned sharply. Oram pushes at it and is beaten by the big spin.
fuller, on the middle and leg stump, line, turns across Oram who leans forward to defend

Nearly holed up to deep midwicket. Another sweep that went awry. Murali is getting considerable turn and bounce on this track and the sweep shot is going to be risky. On this occasion, it falls well short of Dilshan.
low full-toss, driven to long on
on the off stump line, driven to cover
flicked past square-leg for a single
full, driven through cover
on the middle stump line, worked to deep midwicket.
slower in the air, bit more flight, driven to long-on
shout for a catch at short-leg. Tossed-up, on the middle and leg, turns,Styris tries to drive, misses and it bounds off the pad to short-leg.
on the middle stump line, Styris drives with the turn, to right of Fernando at long-on and they run hard to complete two runs
on the off and middle line, turns in, jabbed away with bit of bat and pad. Sangakkara screams out, "How is that?" No one else appeals. Rauf remains impassive.
lands on the leg and middle, doosra, breaks away from Styris who picks it off the turf, adjusts, runs it down to short third man region
flighted delivery, outside off stump, Stryis was looking to sweep it and then changes tack and pats it to off side
outside off stump, Styris lets it go through to Sangakkara who whips the bails off and appeals. The toe was planted inside the crease.
brings up his fifty with a drive to long-off. This is fifth WC 50.
shorter, flatter, faster, on the middle stump line, Oram waits, punches it down to long on
almost squeezed through. Arm ball. Lands outside off, comes in with the angle, Stryis pushes a touch outside the line, edges it on to the pad
outside off, Styris leans forward, square-drives it through backward point.
on the middle stump line, turns in, wristed behind square-leg
overpitched outside off, driven to long-off
on the middle stump line, topspinner, Styris picks it, opens the bat-face, guides it to point
flatter, quicker,, landed outside leg stump, turns in, Oram leans forward and defends.
slower but similar line and length. again, defended
almost edged to Mahela at slip. Just short of him. Oram pushes at a delivery spinning right across him, edges but it falls short of Mahela who makes a half-stop
picks up a single with a drive through the on side

Lovely anticipation from Sangakkara. Almost pulled off a catch. On the middle stump line, Oram opts for a paddle sweep, Sangakkara moves to his right and the ball flies past his helmet. Good work from him.
beaten. Slower in the air, outside off stump, short in length, Styris cuts but misses.
gets the cut shot right this time. 100 up.
on the off and middle, driven to long on
fullish, on the middle and leg, jabbed to left of Dilshan who dives and stops.
comes down the track and drives to long-off.
slightly short in length, turns in from outside off, driven through cover

attempted reverse sweep. Oram misses but so does Sangakkara. It was outside off stump, and kept low, and it actually brushed his gloves and went down, Sangakkara couldn't bend quickly enough. A bye is signalled. hmm...
on the off stump line, not much turn, worked to midwicket
on the off and middle, worked to the on side for a single
beaten. Really slow through the air, Styris is too early into his drive and the ball whooshes past the outside edge. Clever bowling.
leans forward and waits this time before turning it towards midwicket
floated full in length, on the middle stump line, driven to long on
flighted delivery, on the middle and off, driven inside-out to long off
lands on the off stump line, turns in slightly, nudged to midwicket
similar ball, similar stroke. Again it is Mahela who does the fielding
outside off stump, Styris shapes to push it , misses and it thuds into the pad. Outside off stump though. Not even Sangakkara appeals. That must tell you something.
comes down the track, drives to long off
again mahela does the fielding. This time at cover. No he is not running around, just the left and right batting combination.
another drive to long-off from Oram. Another single.
swept to long leg
comes down again, drives inside-out to sweeper cover
on the off stump line, turns in, flicked to midwicket.
reverse-sweep, straight to short third man fielder.
driven to long on for a single
comes down the track, Dilshan drags back the length, Oram lunges forward, dabs to the off side
on the off stump line, driven to midwicket
Nice. Styris was charging down the track and Dilshan slowed up the pace. Styris was made to wait and he merely pushed it back down the track
on the middle and leg stump line, flicked past square-leg
on the off stump line, slightly short, worked past square-leg
outside the off stump line, paddled away to fine-leg
on the off stump line, Styris leans forward, waits, square-drives towards deep cover
tossed-up, on the middle stump line, driven down the track and Jayasuriya moved to his right, dived to make the stop. And he is a so called veteran.
on the off stump line, driven to cover. Good tight over in progress.
yorker length, dug out. "Good Bowling," screams Sangakkara. Who else?
defended on the front foot
beaten! Fuller, almost yorker-length, outside off stump and it squeezes past the hurried jab of Oram
on the middle and leg, turned to midwicket region
on the leg stump line, flicked to short-fine leg
shout for lbw. Rauf doesn't agree. It landed on the off and middle, Styris shaped to drive and it straightened and hit him on the pad. Hawk eye suggests it would have shaven the off stump.
fullish, driven to left of Jayasuriya who again rushes to his left to make the stop
on the middle stump line, jabbed away
slid down leg side, tickled away fine
leans forward, drives through extra cover
chipped over cover. Not in control. He came down the track and had a heave but was beaten in the flight and ended up scooping it over cover.
sweeps to deep square-leg region
on the off stump line, patted back down the track
landed outside leg stump, turns across Oram who nudges it to the off side
on the leg side, worked to backward square-leg
from round the stumps, lands on the leg and middle, goes on straight, pushed away down the pitch
on the middle, turns, worked to midwicket
another reverse-sweep. It was a full-toss that dipped on the leg stump line, swept past point
That's a biggie. First six of the match. Oram backs to the leg side and swung a full delivery over wide long on.
on the middle and Oram pays respect.

Dilshan has the revenge. Oram falls. He came down the track, Dilshan dragged back the length, Oram went through with his lofted drive, but the bottom-hand came off the handle and the ball went high up in the air towards long-on. It hung in the air for a long time and then swirled down, Maharoof went forward, then to his left, then to his right as the ball kept swirling and lunged to his left to hold on to it. Mahela is first to rush across to give Mahroof a big hug.
fullish, on the middle, driven to long-on
leans forward, drives to long on
doosra, lands outside leg stump, turns in, Styris tries to flick, misses and it runs off the pad

McCullum goes cheaply. From round the stumps, it landed on the middle and leg stump line, turns in slightly, McCullum pushes at it, the bat comes outside the line, the ball thuds into the pad. Murali turns around and appeals. No luck. The ball bobs off the pad to left of silly-point where Arnold grabs it. They appeal for a catch and it's given. McCullum is unhappy. As he walks past Rauf, he asks him something and shakes his head at the response.  Confirmation  comes from the umpire  that it was given LBW He was struck in front of leg and middle.
on the middle and leg, driven to long on

slow through the air, on the leg stump line, flicked to deep midwicket. Tharanga fires in a wild throw at the non-striker's end. Had it was more accurate, it could have got interesting. Dilshan is not impressed.
outside off stump, swept away to deep midwicket
doosra on the middle and leg Styris picked it well, drove inside-out to cover
leans forward to defend
flatter, on the middle and leg stump line, turns, flicked to backward square-leg
tossed-up, on the off and middle, driven with the turn, down to long on
Another fatal sweep. A flighted-delivery on the middle stump line, Vettori went for a sweep and swung it straight to deep midwicket.
swept past square-leg
fastish ball, pushed back to the bowler
patted to the off side
another quick ball turned away to short midwicket
waist high full toss, it appears to have slipped out of his hand, Franklin taps it to long-on for a single. That deserved a mighty hoick but he's just in
whipped away to leg, Jayasuriya specialises in fastish straight ones
full toss again, he's flighting them to Franklin and firing them in to Styris. Whipped away to midwicket for a single
loopy ball on off, tapped away to the off side for a single
flat on off, Styris moves across and turns it away in the vacant gaps near square leg. Another easy single
flat on off, defended solidly to the off
flighted and some turn there, Franklin tries to drive but bobs it up dangerously, drops a foot or so in front of the bowler. He is a fantastic catcher Dilshan, they would know it
patted away to the off side for a single
fastish ball on middle, turned away to leg for a single
fired in again, Styris down the ground and chips it in the air to extra cover for a couple. Sensible shot that
tries a similar tactic on the leg side, on the back foot this time and turning it to midwicket. Only a single, though
fired into off, Franklin gets behind the line and defends solidly
another full toss, that should have been put away, slapped to cover for a single. Three full tosses to Franklin and just three runs
whipped away to midwicket after shuffling across and theys camper through a quick two
fast one on middle, Styris moves across the stumps and flicks behind square
lands on the leg stump line, goes on straight, nudged to the on side
almost caught at cover. Decieved by the doosra. On the leg and middle stump line, Styris shapes to turn it to the on side, gets a leading edge and it goes in the air but to the left of cover.
leans forward, pushes to cover point
shout for lbw. It landed outside off stump, from round the stumps, turned in, Styris is beaten, but it struck him outside the off stump.
goes back, picks the doosra this time, turns it to point region
turns it past square-leg
on the off stump line, Franklin steers it to point
drifts in from outside off, pushed towards mid-on region but the short midwicket fielder moves to his right to cut it
similar line, worked to midwicket
almost chipped back to the bowler. Slow in the air, on the off and middle line, Franklin pushes at it, it stops on him but it falls short of the bowler
leans forward to defend a length-delivery on the off and middle
it's a maiden over. Over no 46. on the leg and middle, turned to short fine-leg fielder
landed outside leg stump, Styris sweeps hard to long leg region. Maharoof rushes across to his right and dives to make the stop
fullish, on the middle and leg, dug out back to the bowler
landed outside leg stump, doosra, turned in, Styris shapes to sweep, misses.
on the off stump line, driven to Jayasuriya at long-off
on the middle and leg, Franklin muffs a sweep shot, it bounds off the toe of the bat, towards point
flatter, outside off stump, turns in, wristed to square-leg
Murali finishes his quota. On the off stump line, defended towards cover
comes down the track and drives straight back down the track. Dilshan misfields. That's rare.
chipped over cover. Just over. He backed to the leg side and drove uppishly, Mahela jumps but can't reach it
Biggie. Came down the track and sent it soaring over long-off.

flatter, drifting in from the middle stump line, turned past square-leg. Fernando charges in, fires in a throw. It bounces in front of Sangakkara who gathers, whips the bails off but Franklin drags his bat inside the crease. Only just. It was referred to third umpire.
driven towards long-on and again they run hard to come back for two
flatter, short of length, punched to long-on
yorker-length, on the off and middle,  squeezed down to third man
short and wide, Styris had backed away a touch, reached out for it and cut it straight to cover
screaming yorker, swings in late, Styris tries to get his bat down in a hurry, has a stab, misses and the ball flies past the leg stump
And again. This is brilliant stuff from Fernando. Reverse-swinging yorker. Kissing past the leg stump.
100 up for Styris. Fourth ODI ton. Brought up in style. After two yorkers, Fernando went for a short of length delivery and Styris moved to the leg side and pulled it to deep midwicket boundary
attempted yorker, jabbed away to square-leg
low full-toss, on the off stump line, pushed to cover
Fullish, on the legs, flicked over midwicket. Sangakkara is standing up to the stumps.
Slips down the leg side, Sangakkara can't reach it and it runs to the boundary
fullish, on the off stump line, driven to long -on
fullish, on the off stump line, driven to left of long-on and they will pick up two. Styris on strike.
Swing and a miss. In the zone outside off, Styris tried to drive it inside-out over cover.
attempted-yorker, ends up as a low full-toss, on the middle stump line, scooped to right of long-on

Styris finishes the innings with a four. Full-pitched, on the middle and leg stump line, swung to widish long-on region. Fab effort from Styris. He started off very slowly but recovered to guide the lower-middle order to lift NZ to a fighting total

inn2.comm: hits the deck short of length, around the off stump line, it bounces a touch, Tharanga stands up tall, pushes it down to the off side
similar length, but slightly outside off stump, cut down to point
again short of length, pushed to cover
beaten. Peach of a delivery. Kicked up from a length, Tharanga drives loosely, it whizzes past the outside edge and keeps climbing. It gets big on McCullum who fails to gather.
full in length, just outside off stump, left alone. No ugly surprise for McCullum this time.
Ah...not a surprise but a shock for McCullum. Shocker from Franklin. Way down the leg side and poor McCullum had to dive full-length but only couldn't hold on to it.
in the zone outside off, left alone

run out chance missed. back of length, on the off stump line, pushed towards extra cover. Ross Taylor swooped in from cover, has a shy at non-striker's end but it bounces over the stumps. Jayasuriya had sent Tharanga back after taking a couple of steps
ouch. Dug in short, at the body, around off stump line, Jayasuriya takes his eyes off the ball, tries to duck while turning back. It thuds into his left shoulder and flies over the slips
crash. Short and bit of width outside off, Jayasuriya cuts it past point.
full, straight, on the middle and pushed back down the track
hits the deck short of length, outside off stump, Jayasuriya hops up, taps it close to him on the off side.

Poor McCullum . Everybody seems to be gunning for him. This was short in length, outside off stump, Tharanga has a flash, gets a inner-edge, on to the ground, and flies to right of McCullum who dives but can't reach it.
short of length, outside off stump, pushed to point
fuller, outside off stump, driven to cover
short in length, just outside off stump, Tharanga goes back and across, forces it past point
length-delivery, around off stump, comes in with the angle, Jayasuriya gets behind the line, plays it towards cover

McCullum must have got off the wrong side of the bed. full and on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg. McCullum was in front of the stumps, facing square-leg region. The throw came in and he back-pedaled and guess what .. crashed into the furniture and fell on his back..
short in length, outside off, cut straight to point
slower one. On the off stump line, Tharanga eases it to cover region. He wants a signal but gets out of the suicidal mood and retreats
on the good length, around off stump line, punched back to Bond
Full in length, around off stump line, pushed to extra cover
dropped by Fleming. Fullish, outside off stump line, Tharanga drives square, uppishly and Fleming, who had placed himself at square point, stretches his left hand out but ends up palming it.
short in length, outside off stump, slashed to third man
full and outside off, Jayasuriya slashes, gets a inside-edge to fine leg
on the middle and leg, worked throgh midwicket

What a stunner from Bond. At third man. It was short and outside off, Tharanga gave it the full treatment. It screamed towards Bond, who was a few yards inside the rope. He back-pedals and dives backward to take the catch.
full and wide, Sangakkara moves back and across, cuts to point
fuller, outside off and Sangakkara cashes in. Goes down on a bent knee and caresses it through cover
outside off stump, full in length, cut to point
And again.
fuller, homing in on the off stump, Jayasuriya who chose to stay beside the line, jabs at it in a hurry. It was fuller than he anticipated but manages to keep it out
slower one, short in length, Jayasuriya gets right behind it, pats it cautiously to the on side

Fullish, not much swing, on the off and middle line, driven down the ground. Too much bottom-hand and he went a bit too hard at it. The bat-face shut and he didn't quite time it as well as he would have liked
shovelled past midwicket. In the air. It was slighly short in length, on the middle stump line, Jayasuriya went for the pull and didn't time it well.
leans forward, drives to wide mid-off
slower one. off break action. Sangakkara goes back, works it to square-leg
another slower one, fuller in length, on the middle stump line, Sangakkara eases it towards wide mid-on for a single
Full and outside off, dabbed away late, down to third man
lands on a length, angling down leg side, Sangakkara shuffles across, tries to flick  it, doesn't connect and it runs off the pad down to short fine-leg region
on the off stump line, Sangakkara stabs it towards backward point

around 138 k, short in length, just outside off, Sangakkara cuts, in front of ppint - that says something about the slowness of the track. Having said that, it kicks up at times. Variable bounce on offer.
dug in short, it flies well outside off stump, Sangakkara has a flash and a miss.

But short cover is just a witness as Sangakkara crunches a most glorious cover drive to the fence. Full and wide, on your knees and blitz. That was a Sangakkara special. It was quick but he cracked it even quicker to the boundary

dropped by McMillan at short midwicket, slower ball that time and Sangakkara is deceived. Pokes at it but McMillan can only get his fingers to it, jumping up at short midwicket and lunging his right hand up towards the ball. Tough chance but a chance nevertheless

Welcome Mr Gillespie, says Jayasuriya. It's short and on the pads, Jayasuriya latches on to it in a flash and pulls it away way behind square for a big hit. Gillespie's first World Cup ball and he has run into the marauder
down the leg side again and Jayasuriya is not going to spare those, helps it along the way to the fine-leg fence for another four. He's taking him on for sure
around the wicket angle from Gillespie this time, straighter and tighter. No room for Jayasuriya and he pats it confidently to short midwicket
oversteps this time, Gillespie struggling to get his rhythm. Straight, cramping Jayasuriya for room but no need to take any chances

That's a cracking loft over mid-on, targetting Gillespie by taking the arial route. Full ball on off and he puts his front foot across and blasts it over mid-on for another four. Chancy but most effective
on the pads again and Jayasuriya tucks it past shot fine leg easily. Wayward and too easy for Jayasuriya
on the pads again, lucky to get away with it this time. Ball strikes Jayasuriya's pads and trickles away to the leg side
short and wide, Jayasuriya lashes violently but Ross Taylor anticipates that well at cover, full length dive stops a certain four

that's dangerous, speedy from Bond and straight on off, Jayasuriya goes for the slog across the line but the inside edge trickles away to short fine leg. That could easily have been played onto the stumps.
full and on off, Sangakkara confidently pushes it to mid-off. He's looking in fine fettle here, the drives are being crunched well
Slower ball outside off, left alone
driven back to the bowler, full and on middle he's behind the line without much fuss
straight and tight again. Bond finds his direction after a wide first ball. Defended to the off side
around the wicket and full on off, steered away to cover for a single
shot this time but well directed, Sangakkara pulls it away for a single. Gillespie needs a steady over here
too wide and too full, slashed away by Jayasuriya in characteristic fashion. Sweeper is there on the boundary and they pick up a couple
smacked loft over short midwicket, Fleming throws himself in the air but can only parry it with his left hand. Dropped might be too harsh but these are the chances that turn games.
full and outside off, Sangakkara shoulders arms, quite stylishly.
full and outside off, Sangakkara stretches and drives to cover. There is a good balance about his batting here. Relatively better over from Gilelspie, one where he could have got a wicket too
flighted delivery, outside off stump, pushed to cover
outside off stump, Jayasuriya drives, edges it to short third man
fullish, outside off stump, Jayasuriya rocks back, cuts it through backward point
on the middle, turns, Jayasuriya wrists it to behind square-leg
from round the stumps, on the off and middle, defended on the front foot
fuller, flatter, on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg
drifting to the pad, tucked to fine leg
released with a scrambled seam, outside off stump, carved through cover
fullish, outside off, driven to cover
slanting in from outside off stump, defended on the front foot
fuller, driven back down the track and Gillespie goes down to stop it.
on a length, angling in from round the stumps, Jayasuriya shuffles across, nudges it to square-leg.
on the off and middle line, tapped to the off side
slower in the air, outside off stump, square-driven past point
lands on the leg stump line, deflected to square-leg
on the off stump line, dabbed towards point
slow in the air, on the middle and leg, Sangakkara is beaten by the lack of pace, wants to nudge it to on side, misses.
leans back, places it to backward point for a single
on the off stump line, fullish, driven to long off
short in length, angling away, Jayasuriya goes back, short-arm jabs it through backward point
short and wide, cut to deep point
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
length-delivery, outside off, driven to long-off
slightly slower one, off cutter, punched past point, misfielded there, for a single
on the off stump line, defended to cover
goes back to defend a length-delivery back to the bowler
faster one, arm ball, jabbed away to the off side
slows up this one. On the middle and leg, nibbled away to square-leg
again slow in the air, bit more flight and Jayasuriya sweeps it behind square-leg
lands on the off stump line, goes on straight, Jayasuriya backs away, doesn't get much room, dabs it to point
leans forward and drives a fullish delivery to cover
on a length, around off stump, cut to point
on the off stump line, drives but gets a edge through the vacant slip region
full and outside off, square-driven to point
this time he gets through the off side ring and drives to sweeper cover
on the off stump line, off cutter, guided to backward point
on the off stump line, pushed back down the track
really slow in the air, slightly short too, Sangakkara opens up his stance and pulls it to deep midwicket. He had all the time in the world to place it but ....
lands on the middle, turns towards leg, Jayasuriya goes back, whips it past square-leg
quicker, flatter, lands outside off, straightens, cut to backward point region
well flighted delivery, slow in the air, lands on off stump line, spins in, worked past midwicket
slashes at the width, down to sweeper cover
slower one, full in length, Sangakkara shapes to push it towards cover, edges it back down the track
goes back, steers a length-delivery to point
slightly short, well outside off, carved away to left of backward point where Fleming does well to stop it.
picks up a single with a drive through the on side
off-cutter, outside off, patted towards cover. Sri Lanka are in no hurry, they don't need to. New Zealand have to do something here.
from round the stumps comes a length-delivery, around off stump, defended on the front foot.
glides forward and drives past the bowler
on the middle stump line, slightly short in length, lapped around the corner, to long leg
short in length, punched on the up to cover. McCullum likes that delivery. "Cmon Oram. C'mon mate. C'mon guys"
again punched to cover
fullish, outside off, nudged to cover.
on the off stump line, skidding off the turf, square-driven to point
on a length, slanting across Jayasuriya who tries to force it off the back foot but mistimes it to cover
low full-toss, driven straight to cover. He missed an opportunity there.

loud appeal for a catch. It was fullish and angling away from Jayasuriya who drives, gets an inside-edge and it bounced  just behind the right boot, on to the ground, and bobs to McCullum who goes up in appeal.
almost sliced to point. Drives with an open-face of the bat, it goes off the outside edge, in the air, but short of the diving point fielder
overpitched outside off, driven to cover
slightly short in length, on the middle and off, swatted past square-leg
just outside off stump, worked to midwicket
on the off stump line, driven to point
on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg
slightly short in length, outside the off stump, Jayasuriya shuffes across, pats it towards widish mid-on region and picks up the single that brings up his fifty. What a great form he is in.
off cutter, outside off stump, Jayasuriya moves across, pushes it to cover region
There he goes. Up over midwicket. Short in length, outside off stump line, he rocks back and pulls it over midwicket.
low full-toss, outside off, driven straight to cover
bit of width outside off stump, fullish, dabbed to McMillan at point
full in length, sliding away from Jayasuriya who leans back, late-cuts it to third man
slightly short, around the off stump, cut to McMillan at point
on the off stump line, Jayasuriya lunges at it, gets a inside-edge down to fine leg
short in length, outside off stump, another single is milked. Pushed to deep point
short again, outside off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
on the off stump line, on a good length, defended to the off side
fuller, outside off stump, Sangakkara pushes at it, gets a outside edge to third man
on a length, outside off stump, coming in a touch, run down to third man
comes in from outside off stump, from round the stumps, Sangakkara shuffles across, whips it behind square-leg
full and outside off, cut to third man
Jayasuriya tries to late-cut but can't get past Fleming at backward point
And again
is successful this time and cuts it past Fleming. Oram gets across from thirdman but fumbles near the rope. Poor effort. Hmm....
leans forward and defends to cover
full in length, around off stump, cut down to right of Oram who makes the stop this time. Ironic cheers from the crowd.
on the middle and leg, from round the stumps, flicked to long leg
again slipping down leg, another single down to Mark Gillespie at long leg

Jayasuriya falls. McCullum can finally smile. Landed on a length, well outside off stump, Jayasuriya tries to chop it down to third man, gets a bottom-edge and McCullum does well to snap it up. Good knock from Jayasuriya; he has laid a nice platform for the other batsmen.
outside off stump line, Mahela tries to run it down to thirdman, gets a inner-edge and it rolls away to the off side
Hello? Mahela, new to the crease, just walks across, reaches the pitch of a full-length delivery, on the off stump line and flicks it over wide midwicket .
slightly short, outside off stump, dragged past square-leg. It was not a full-fledged pull, he sort of helped it to the leg side
drifts down leg side, again short in length, lapped around the corner, to fine-leg region
And again. Hmm....
slower one, on the off stump line, defended towards McMillan at point.
on the off stump line, fullish, driven to deep cover
outside off stump and Mahela leans on to it and late-cuts it to third man
on the off stump line, pushed to point
Short in length, pulled down to the ground and past square-leg
dug in short, it doesn't rear up, not much pace on this track, pulled down to long leg
fullish, on the off and middle, pushed to cover
leans forward to defend a length-delivery on the off and middle.
leans forward to push it to the on side
skips down the track, turns to midwicket
slightly short in length, cut past point
lands outside off stump, goes on with the angle, Mahela leans back, cuts to deep point
flighted up, loopy delivery and it dipped outside off, Sangakkara tries to sweep but mistimes it and the ball rolls over the on side
lands on a length, outside off stump, pushed to cover
full in length, around off stump, Mahela guides it to third man.
full and wide outside off, Sangakkara reaches it, carves it to point
on the middle stump line, pushed to the on side
full in length, outside off, punched to deep cover
slips down leg side, glanced to fine-leg boundary
full and on the pads, worked away to the leg side
slower one, well down leg, left alone and wide called
full, flighted and outside the off, eased through cover

short and on the stumps, Jayawardene sees it a touch late and decides to climb into the pull shot anyway, it's hit reasonably hard but not hard enough or high enough to get past the substitute fielder Hamish Marshall at midwicket. He doesn't drop those and Jaywardene kicks himself all the way back to the pavilion for giving his wicket away so softly just when Sri Lanka were coasting along. Big wicket for New Zealand this!
full and on the stumps, Chamara Silva sweeps hard but the ball goes off the bottom edge to short fine-leg
full and a bit down leg, this time the sweep beats the man at short fine-leg and Chamara Silva is off the mark
just short of a good length and on the off, defended back down the pitch with a straight bat
short and a bit of width, Sangakkara cuts and cuts well, beating the infield but there's a man on the fence
very full and on the off, Bond hurries the ball through, Chamara Silva watches the ball carefully and defends back down the pitch. When will the bouncer come?
another full one, it's straight too, defended back down the pitch. Is Bond setting Silva up here?
low full-toss on the stumps, clipped away to the leg side ... just one ball left in the over. Is Chamara Silva thinking what we are and wondering if it will be the bouncer?
nope, it's the double bluff and Bond spears in the yorker, well dug out by Silva
slips down leg side.
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
fuller, outside off, square-driven to point
on the middle and leg, tucked past square-leg
beaten. Fullish, outside off stump, Chamara goes on a bent knee and tries to drill it through cover, misses. There was no sweeper cover, now one is moved in. Fine leg is up
yorker-length, outside off stump, jabbed away to third man
yorker, on the middle stump line, Silva stops his front foot movement - it was coming across, and stabs the delivery to the off side
short in length, mistimes a cut to point
fullish, outside off stump, square-driven to point
full-pitched on the middle and leg, Silva gets his front foot across, McCullum got excited there, was about to shout for lbw, when the bat came around the pad and the ball was turned to midwicket
picks up a single past square-leg
on the off and middle, turned to left of midwicket. Sangakkara is down the track, looking for a run and he is sent back. He makes it back in time. The throw was not on target though
Smooth. Full-pitched outside off stump and Silva leans forward and drives through extra cover. Fulton couldn't get across in time from sweeper position to make the stop.
On the middle and leg stump line, Silva shuffles across, thrusts his left leg across and swings it over square-leg. Cheeky.
Three in a row. Cute this time. Full and outside off, Silva leant forward, opened the bat-face and guided it past the short-third man fielder.
on the middle stump line, steered to cover point
yorker-length, again Silva was pushing his left leg across, stopped it, flicked  towards square-leg
low full toss, in the blockhole, pushed back to the bowler
another low full-toss, outside off stump, square-driven to point
yorker, on the middle stump line, dug out , back to the bowler
another low full-toss, on the middle, driven to mid-on
short in length this time, homing in on the middle and off line, guided to point
fullish, outside off stump, it lands after crossing the stumps, Silva tries to slice it away through backward point but can't connect.
on the off stump line, punched through cover
on the off stump line, Sanga stands tall, punches it down to long on
full in length, on the middle stump line, pushed to the on side
slap. Short and outside off stump, Silva is very quick on his feet, glides back and cuts it past point
around the off stump, full in length, Silva dabs it to right of short third man, Sangakkara calls him over for a quick single and he responds
slower one, outside off stump, driven to cover
comes down the track and lofts towards long-off
comes down and drives to long-off
slow in the air, bit more air, on the middle stump line, defended with bat and pad close together
quicker, on the off and middle, pushed to cover

Done in the flight. Vettori tossed it up, slow in the air, Silva came down the track and is made to wait a touch and he lofts it straight to long-off. Sangakkara says something to him as he walks past. Maybe he was admonishing him or may be he was asking for some special item to be ordered for dinner.  I think it was something about the rash stroke.
flighted up, full in length, on the middle, driven back to the bowler.
on the middle and leg, glanced away to long leg
on the off stump line, Dilshan tries to run it to third man region and is beaten
on the middle and leg, whipped to square-leg
short and on the middle stump line, pulled through midwicket.
length-delivery, on the middle stump line, punched to long-on
well outside the off stump, Dilshan has a flash and a miss.
on the off stump line, turned to midwicket
on the middle and leg, goes back, works it to square-leg. Fifty for Sanga. 39th ODI fifty, 6th against NZ.
full, on the off stump line, Dilshan backs away a touch and tries to thrash it through off side, gets a inside-edge to the on side. Sangakkara shouts some thing from the other end.
slipping down leg side, Dilshan is hit on the pads while trying to defend. McCullum screams but he is the only man appealing.
leans forward, drives to long-off for a single
full, on the off stump line, driven to cover.
overpitched outside off, driven to long-off.
low full-toss, pushed back to the bowler.
full and sliding down leg side, Sangakkara wants to whip it on side, misses and it bounds off the pad to the off side. The eternal optimist McCullum clears his throat
full-pitched, on the off and middle, driven to long-off
another no ball. Driven to long-on.
full-toss, on the middle and leg, wristed to MacMillan at deep midwicket
overpitched outside off stump, Sanga goes down on his knee and proposes, disposes it rather, through cover. Classy.
slightly short, Dilshan presses back after leaning forward and cuts to deep point
on the leg stump line, tickled to right of Fleming at short fine leg and he will pick up a single. 20 to win. 200 up.
arm-ball, Dilshan is beaten trying to cut, gets a edge and it runs past McCullum.
floated on the middle, eased to long on
flighted-up, comes down the track and drives along the ground to widish long-off
takes a few steps down the track and drives to long-off
on the off stump line, punched to long on
slightly slower, on the off stump line, Dilshan waits, cuts it to deep point
hit on the up, to long-off. They are doing it in singles here.
Another single. This time to long-on.
comes in from outside off stump, Sangakkara gets behind the line, pushes back to the bowler.
fulller, on the off and middle, deflected to midwicket. Another no ball. 26 extras.
slower one, pushed it outside off stump, Sangakkara is sucked into a square-drive, runs off the outer edge, in the air, through the vacant gully region, down to third man region
floated on the off stump line, Sangakkara reaches the pitch of the delivery and sends it down to long-off
on the middle stump line, pushed back to Vettori
on the off stump line, driven down the track.
tossed-up, inviting Dilshan to have a go but he comes down the track and pushes it along the ground to long-off. It looks like Sangakkara's chat has paid off.
Deja-vu.  Few steps down the track and a drive down the ground.
quicker, flatter, on the off and middle, square-driven to deep point
full in length, on the off stump line, partly edged, partly steered to point
fullish, outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover
on the off and middle, punched down the ground
And pigs will fly. He just leans forward, drives to long-on for yet another single. Very clinical.
lands on a length, around off stump, defended back down the track
McCullum shouts 'Catch' as Sangakkara drives on the up and it flies over the outstretched hands of Oram.
He does it! It was full and outside leg, Sangakkara, who has maintained a monk like patience today, swings it past the short fine-leg fielder.
